Class jvLite

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Panel
          • java.applet.Applet
            • jvLite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public final class jvLite
extends java.applet.Applet
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener
    Applet runs jvLite, a light version of the JavaView viewer. jvLite does not have a control panel or any other GUI features. Also most geometry classes are eliminated except jv.project.PgJvxSrc.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public void destroy()
        Does clean-up when applet is destroyed by the browser. Here we just close and dispose all our control windows.

      • run

        public void run()
        Configure and initialize the viewer, load system and user projects. One of the user projects may be selected here.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Standalone application support. The main() method acts as the applet's entry point when it is run as a standalone application. It is ignored if the applet is run from within an HTML page.
